Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power, such as Draconic Bloodline.

Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

Sorcerous Origins

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.Rjb0lD5bbW3YhIAp]{Aberrant Mind}

An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around your mind, giving you psionic power. You can now touch other minds with that power and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse.

@UUID[Compendium.5e-complete.5e-subclasses.HLbbDaEJ1zzVEvej]{Clockwork Soul}

The cosmic force of order has suffused you with magic. That power arises from Mechanus or a realm like it-a plane of existence shaped entirely by clockwork efficiency.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.jWtQOTzC9A2HtT8O]{Draconic Bloodline}

Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.lsP19T6BarGK0reD]{Divine Soul}

Sometimes the spark of magic that fuels a sorcerer comes from a divine source that glimmers within the soul. Having such a blessed soul is a sign that your innate magic might come from a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.huX93i8sbir1Wrt7]{Shadow Magic}

You are a creature of shadow, for your innate magic comes from the Shadowfell itself. You might trace your lineage to an entity from that place, or perhaps you were exposed to its fell energy and transformed by it.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.SOTXNaXm4C8HvhOc]{Storm Sorcery}

Your innate magic comes from the power of elemental air. This power comes from a variety of sources; whatever the case, the magic of the storm permeates your being.

@UUID[Compendium.5e-complete.5e-subclasses.G4DD6CwDNwwIpR31]{Wild Magic}

Your innate magic comes from the wild forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation.
